basic_data.name: Secret City Adventures: Murdoch Mysteries Escape Game

address.streetAddress: 330 Walmer Rd Casa Loma's Stable Coachman's House

description: Secret City Adventures are pioneers in theatrical escape room games and immersive experiences in Toronto. We design, develop, and deliver unique games that push the boundaries of storytelling, where players are the protagonists and the heroes! In this original escape game Detective Murdoch is missing and as Toronto's newest constables you've been called into action, but the clock is ticking! You only have 60 minutes to save Murdoch. Discover the clues, piece together the evidence, crack the case, and unravel the Secret of Station House No. 4!

reviews.title: Great escape room experience
text: This was our first time doing an escape room and this one was certainly very fun.  Because we a fans of the TV show, it made it all the more engaging.  The addition of two actors in the game also added a wonderful element to the experience.  The puzzles were challenging and you definitely had to work as a team to see how all the clues fit.  I really didn't think we were going to figure it out.  With less than 2 minutes to go, we managed to solve the mystery and help Murdoch escape imminent death!  At the end, the  actors told us that less than 10% of the groups are able to solve the game so we felt really good about that!  All in all, definitely well organized and highly recommended.

reviews.title: A marvellous gift for a Murdoch fan!
text: My family treated me, a devoted Murdoch fan, to this afternoon adventure as a Christmas gift. The timing was perfect as we scheduled it for the week after the airing of the 200th episode (which was an ideal refresher of plots and characters from past episodes). The actors who guided us through the mystery were attentive, funny, engaged and helpful, and they encouraged collaborative (rather than competitive) problem-solving. The setting in the Casa Loma Coachman's house is ideal for this period piece. There were a few activities where some knowledge of the series was helpful, but it is not essential. I noticed that younger guests, and those who had participated in mystery room events before, were at an advantage when it came to suspending disbelief, diving in, and just going with the flow. Despite my more advanced age (!) I managed to solve one of the key clues for this mystery. I had a wonderful time and would recommend this as a fun experiential gift for any group, Murdoch fans or not.

reviews.title: Incredible experience.
text: I have done many escape rooms in my day through many different companies.
The decor for this particular one was perfect. You really feel like you’re in the era, in the detectives office. The props are high quality as are the actors outfits and acting skills.
The use of actors in the game is so much more interactive and fun, entertaining and adds to the experience 100%!
The puzzles were extremely challenging in this one but doable with some hints from the actors and putting your head together as a group.
My friend and I had SUCH a great time during this escape room, we got super into everything thanks to the actors and the overall experience.
Highly recommend 10/10!!

reviews.title: Great family fun
text: This was our first experience of an Escape Room. We were part of a group of 10. You do need a number of people to stand any chance of solving all the clues within the hour allotted.

This is more of a murder mystery theme rather than an escape and the inclusion of actors added another dimension. They were able to give hints when needed which kept an exciting pace to the game. Regardless we failed to complete it, but we got close and I understand that this is a particularly difficult game.
Just also to note that this game is not actually played in the castle.

reviews.title: If you are into escape rooms, this is a MUST when visiting Toronto!
text: Firstly, if you are concerned that being a fan of Murdock Mysteries is a must to enjoy this game, fear not. However, as fans it did enhance the experience.

Secondly, don’t be put off by the quantity of people involved (trust us when we say there’s plenty of clues to track) and the likelihood of playing with people you don’t know. We were concerned having only played a number of escape rooms with a maximum of 7 people and all were friends. It adds an interesting challenge! Although I still think my preference would be to play with people we know.

Finally, this escape room by far has been one of the most well thought out and carefully crafted experiences, with its amazing location, challenging puzzles and interesting interactions with live actors, we don’t know what else they could have done to enhance this activity further. So much so, we couldn’t help but book another escape room!

reviews.title: An excellent adventure!
text: This was a great event! I loved the inclusion of a couple of actors - they lent authenticity to the experience. This was my first escape room. Our family was joined by a few others and we enjoyed the group dynamics, getting to know a few others, each having something different to contribute. I think we would have been overwhelmed if we had been just on our own. The actors did an effective job of enhancing the experience. Now I'm not sure what I'd think of doing a room where there is no cast! Kudos to planners, designers, and participants. Thanks for a great time!

reviews.title: Many Moving Parts But Very Fun
text: This is my 3rd escape room game, but my first in Canada. As a fan of the show this is based on, it was really fun. My friends had never watched the show but were able to do just fine. It's not a requirement. Good twists and turns. We needed a bit more time - maybe 10 mins or so - and we would've escaped. The only negative is that there are so many moving parts that it's easy to lose track of time just trying to solve a puzzle or 2. The group I was in totaled 11, so that helped a bit. Can't imagine just 6 people (minimum required) solving everything in an hour. Perhaps if they were all friends. It was a bit challenging working with so many strangers. At first, small groups formed to work on the mini puzzles. Everything fell off at the end when we all had to come together to solve the last puzzle. Lots of panic and unnecessary shouting. Would've loved to have won, as it was my birthday. The game was advertised as being 90 minutes but was only 60 minutes. If it was actually 90 mins or even 75, we would've escaped the room. Overall, still a great time. Highly recommend. Do it with calm, level-headed friends and family if you can!

reviews.title: Fun immersive theatrical experience (even if you've never watched Murdoch Mysteries)
text: We had 8 in our group (including a 10-year-old) and had a fantastic time. I had never watched the Murdoch Mysteries tv show but this didn't affect my enjoyment of the experience. LOVE the theatrical aspect, and the two actors involved in our session were excellent - the latter gave us hints in creative ways when we needed them. Even though we didn't completely solve the mystery by the end, we felt as if we had been super-close and we all had a lot of fun. There was a good mix of puzzle types, too (observational, deductive, etc.) so that no one felt left out...the actors helped a great deal with the latter as well. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: First Timer
text: A very strategic game in an old mansion. Our group of 12 was all family and we almost completed the overall challenge. We probably required only an additional 5 more minutes. I don't know if the game would have been as much fun if we played with strangers.

reviews.title: Murdock Mystery Game
text: The game was really fun.  There were 12 of us taking part in the game and 3 actors.  We weren’t able to solve the mystery in the allotted one hour but did come close.  I would highly recommend it for a great evening with friends or family!

reviews.title: Murdoch Mysteries Station House No. 4 Escape Room
text: This is a classic Murdoch mystery to solve.  Where is detective Murdoch since he was kidnapped by the villain?  Solve using clues, deciphering codes, crossword puzzle, and I won't spoil it anymore.  Great fun with twists and deception to overcome!

reviews.title: You should try it!
text: Very cool, tricky puzzles and fun interaction with the actors. As far as escape experiences go this wasn't our favourite but that comes down to personal preference and not the quality of this game itself, which was excellent. Since you're in such a large group (in our case, all strangers, but nice ones) there isn't the same amount of understanding what's going on as there is with smaller rooms but there are definitely enough puzzles for everyone to work on alone or in small groups. Just be prepared to not know how your group came to certain solutions or where that key came from unless you can be everywhere at once. Definitely worth experiencing though.

reviews.title: Very Well Done! Great Christmas Gift!
text: I bought 6 tickets to this escape room for a Christmas gift this year. Some of us had done escape rooms before and others hadn't. We were all amazing by the level of detail and complexity of the puzzles. While we didn't manage to escape, we all had a blast and will definitely try the other Secret city Adventures' escape rooms in the future! This one was one of the most detailed and challenging escape rooms that I've done (and I've likely done about 15 by now). So fun that they had live characters to help you along!

reviews.title: Company Year End Party
text: Wow! This is the best Escape Room we have played by far. The attention to details and the addition of actors really makes this a fulsome experience. The clues and set decorations were well thought out and not too easy to figure out. The staff are great and really help to make the experience fun. We are looking forward to trying out this company's other escape rooms soon!

reviews.title: Great night out
text: A group of 12 of us  had an amazing experience here. We did The Secret of Staion House no. 4.  The clues were challenging and so creative! It really made us use our brains! Having a private group of 12 was great. The actors were so good! They were funny and helpful.  We all thoroughly enjoyed the escape experience!! Will definitely be doing more! I highly recommend this for an exciting group experience!

reviews.title: Great immersive experience!
text: We arrived as a group of 5, combining with other groups of 2 & 3 people. Only a few of us actually watch the show - it doesn't really matter though. About half of us had done escape rooms before. For those that hadn't, this escape room certainly sets the bar high for others they may do in future... There were lots of puzzles to solve, so it was easy to find something to work on either independently or in small groups. The puzzles were fun and varied, and took us to the very end our alotted time. The accompanying actors were great, and provided a fun twist and an overall better immersive experience than other escape rooms. Highly recommend this Murdoch Mystery escape room!

reviews.title: Secret City Adventures delivers another quality escape experience.
text: One of the few escape room companies able to accommodate larger groups, we settled for Station House no. 4 despite none of us being Murdoch Mystery fans.
We were not disappointed - puzzles were fun, varied, and intuitive. Actors did a great job staying in character and keeping the atmosphere light without being too overbearing with "hints".

My only criticism is that the final puzzle lacks that eureka! moment that brings the whole story together to give teams that ultimate feeling of achievement. Otherwise, Secret City Adventures has put together yet another winner!

reviews.title: Murdoch Escape Room
text: We had a wonderful experience at the Murdoch Mysteries escape room. This is our third escape room and the best so far! You don't need to have watched Murdoch to have a good experience but for those of us who are fans there are a lot of Murdoch references included in the room. It was our first escape room with live actors and they made it that much more fun. There were a lot of interesting puzzles to solve, as one would expect in a Detective Murdoch mystery. Hope you try it and have as much fun as we did.

reviews.title: One of my favourite escape rooms so far
text: The puzzles were difficult without being obtuse, and really creative. Plus the actors did a great job at making it immersive (and subtly pointing you in the right direction when needed). It was a lot of fun, and I highly recommend it.

reviews.title: The Secret of Station House No. 4
text: This was my first room escape adventure and it absolutely exceeded all expectations. You don't have to be familiar with the Murdoch Mysteries TV series but being a fan certainly enhances the experience.

The room plays out like being part of an episode, driving the story forward as the puzzles are solved. There are so many delightful surprises, my favourite among them was surprising myself in taking a risk that ended up being the right move.

The actors were utterly convincing in their roles and I can't help but think they may have been on the show at some point (bravo, gents!). I love that it took place in the historic George Brown House, it really adds to the immersive atmosphere of early 20th century Toronto. There was so much to explore in the puzzle room, I don't think I saw it all.

Overall it's a marvelous and wholesome experience. I wish I could blank my memory of the puzzle answers and do it over again with a fresh mind. Consider me among the first in line should they ever do another Murdoch themed room.

reviews.title: The Clues were SO Clever/Fun!
text: Just went to their Zelda Adventure in Vancouver, B.C. The clues were SO clever and fun. Seemed like everybody was having a great time!

reviews.title: Love murdoch and Loved the Game
text: This is very well done and my boyfriend and I were included in a small group with 8 other adults. Felt welcome and love that the person doing the introduction promotes a team name and gives great instruction before entering. The escape game itself was well thought out and decor was on point. Love the antiques. Our team was literally a minute from finishing but we still all had a blast! Would love to do some of their other games.

reviews.title: Awesome experience!
text: This was the first time my friends and I had tried this game experience and we were SO impressed! The atmosphere of the George Brown house was perfect to set the scene for our Murdoch Mystery. Actors were fabulous and were able to give us hints in creative ways! The puzzles were challenging and diverse. Our team was so close to solving the Mystery. If only we had 5 more minutes. We were lucky to experience this game on its last running weekend. Would be more then willing to recommend to friends. Adding the Casa Loma Escape rooms to the list! Secret City Adventuress is a great company!

reviews.title: So much fun!!!
text: We watch Murdoch Mysteries often and chose this game because of the show. It was our first escape room experience, and we had an absolutely fantastic time. The actors were great and played along really nicely! The plot and the venue fit each other perfectly. Too bad this is the last week for the game at this location. We can't wait for more games in this  series!

reviews.title: Incredible experience!
text: Visited Toronto from the US specifically to play The Secret of Station House No. 4 with my niece before it closes in June. It was well worth the trip. We had an amazing time and the entire experience exceeded our expectations. Thanks so much for a truly wonderful memory!

reviews.title: Great detail and actors involvement
text: This takes place in the historic George Brown house and is a lot of fun. The actors were great and provided just the right amount of involvement to help not hinder our progress.

reviews.title: Great fun!
text: This escape room was an absolute blast! My friend and I were in a group of about a dozen or so other people and everyone had something to do. There were a lot of surprises and it was fun working with strangers to solve the mysteries. The actors were great and really added to the experience offering gentle hints where needed or staying silent if you were on the right track.
My group got SO CLOSE to solving it but we ran out of time. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who likes puzzles or games!

reviews.title: Great fun!
text: We're big Murdoch fans and this was the first escape room experience for us. One teen with us and one 10 yr old who found three clues! Definitely going to try their other adventures!

reviews.title: Toronto 2018
text: Awesome!!!! This was our first escape room experience and it was awesome!!  Very nice decor and the actors were magnificent.  I highly recommend making this high on your list of things to do while in Toronto.

reviews.title: New Favourite
text: Enjoyed the escape rooms at Casa Loma, but enjoyed this one even more.  Fewer rooms / spaces, but the interactions with the actors made far more sense here and the variety of puzzles was great.

reviews.title: Fun night out!
text: We were asked to participate by our neighbours who had extra space in their group booking and it was a really fun experience with new friends made! The actors were so fun, stayed in character, and gave just the right amount of clues so we could figure it out without feeling like we are being given any answers. They kept the game and the suspense going! A really fun thing to do before going to dinner/drinks with friends!
